title: 103_hr58
content: The Act may be cited as the "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993". Conveyance vessels are addressed in the Act. The Secretary of Transportation has the authority to convey 2 vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations operating Liberty Ships or Victory Ships as memorials to merchant mariners. The vessels must be at least 4,000 displacement tons, have no usefulness to the Government, and be scheduled for scrapping. The Secretary of Transportation can convey vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations operating Liberty Ships or Victory Ships as memorials. The vessels must be over 4,000 displacement tons, have no government use, and be set for scrapping. Organizations must agree to sell the vessel for scrap and use the proceeds to refurbish a memorial ship. The Secretary of Transportation can convey vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations operating Liberty Ships or Victory Ships as memorials. The organizations must refurbish the ships to participate in commemorative activities, and any proceeds from scrapping must be returned to the United States. Amounts returned will be deposited in the Vessel Operations Revolving Fund. The Secretary can convey vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations operating Liberty Ships or Victory Ships as memorials. The vessels shall be delivered at their current location, in their current condition, and at no cost to the Government. The authority to convey vessels expires 2 years after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. DOCUMENTATION OF VESSELS. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels, including ABORIGINAL, AFTERSAIL, ALEXANDRIA, AMANDA, ARBITRAGE II, and ARIEL. The vessels listed with their registration numbers are: AMANDA (MC-1125-FR), ARBITRAGE II (962861), ARIEL (954762), BRANDARIS (263174), COMPASS ROSE (695865), DIXIE (513159), ELISSA (697285), EMERALD PRINCESS (530095), ENTERPRISE (692956), and EUROPA STAR (588270). The vessels listed with their registration numbers are: GAZELA OF PHILADELPHIA (PA-4339-AF), GRAY (CT-5944-AJ), GRIZZLY PROCESSOR (369183), GUSTO (624951), GYPSY COWBOY (550771), and IMPATIENT LADY (553952). The vessels listed with their registration numbers are: ISLAND GIRL (674840), JULIET (MC-1669-LM), KALENA (HA-1923-E), LAURISA (924052), LIBBY ROSE (236976), LISERON (971339), MARINE STAR (248329), MARINER (285452), and MARY B (KY-0098-HX). The vessels listed with their registration numbers are: MARINER (285452), MARY B (KY-0098-HX), MOONSHINE (974226), MYSTIQUE (921194), NORTHERN LIGHT (237510), PAI NUI (HA-6949-D), PANDACEA (665892), PELICAN (234959), PLAY PRETTY (975346), PRINCE OF TIDES II (903858), and RBOAT (563955). The following vessels are listed with their registration numbers: SABLE (MS-1841-AM), SERENA (965317), SHILOH (902675), SIDEWINDER (991719), SWELL DANCER (622046), TESSA (675130), TOP DUCK (990973), VIKING (286080), and WHIT CON TIKI (663823). Foreign-flag vessel H851, named VIKING and WHIT CON TIKI, are permitted to engage in coastwise trade to transport an offshore drilling platform jacket from Texas to Viosca Knoll 989 on the Outer Continental Shelf, despite restrictions under the Merchant Marine Act and other laws. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels LADY CHARL II and LINETTE with coastwise and Great Lakes endorsements, despite certain restrictions under maritime laws. The Secretary of Transportation may issue a certificate of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for the vessel M/V TWIN DRILL if it undergoes a major conversion in a US shipyard costing more than 3 times its purchase value. The vessel M/V TWIN DRILL can be documented under chapter 121 of title 46, United States Code with a coastwise endorsement if it undergoes a major conversion in a US shipyard or if a new vessel of equal or greater capacity is constructed within a specified timeframe. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with coastwise and fishery endorsements for vessels REEL CLASS and DA WARRIOR, bypassing certain sections of title 46, United States Code. The vessels UST ATLANTIC and UST PACIFIC may be sold to non-US citizens and transferred to a foreign registry. The vessel AMY CHOUEST is considered less than 500 gross tons for US maritime laws. The Secretary of Commerce may deploy a Real-Time System in Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel for nautical charting and marine safety improvements. The Secretary of Transportation will establish a 3-year pilot program for Sealift Training at the Massachusetts Maritime Academy. The House of Representatives passed the bill on November 20, 1993.
